cz.syntea.xdef.sys

Class SDatetime

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.xml.datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar
      • cz.syntea.xdef.sys.SDatetime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<SDatetime>

    public class SDatetime
extends javax.xml.datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar
implements java.lang.Comparable<SDatetime>
    Implementation of date and time values. This class implements abstract methods from javax.xml.datatype.XMLGregorianCalendar.

      • getEasterMonday

        public final SDatetime getEasterMonday()
        Get Easter Monday. The algorithm used here was published in the Explanatory Supplement to the Astronomical Almanac, Oudin J.M. (1940), ed. Seidelmann P. K. (1992).
        Returns:
        SDatetime object with Easter Monday.
        Throws:
        SRuntimeException - if Easter Monday can't be computed.

      • getFirstDayOfWeek

        public final int getFirstDayOfWeek()
        Get the first day of the week. In the US, the first day of the week is Sunday and in France it is Monday.
        Returns:
        The first day of the week.

      • getDayOfWeekInMonth

        public final int getDayOfWeekInMonth()
        Get the day of week in month. Get the ordinal number of the day of the week within the current month. Together with the DAY_OF_WEEK field, this uniquely specifies a day within a month. Unlike WEEK_OF_MONTH and WEEK_OF_YEAR, this field value does not depend on getFirstDayOfWeek() or getMinimalDaysInFirstWeek(). DAY_OF_MONTH 1 through 7 always correspond to DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 1; 8 through 14 correspond to DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 2, and so on. DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 0 indicates the week before DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 1. Negative values count back from the end of the month, so the last Sunday of a month is specified as DAY_OF_WEEK = SUNDAY, DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH=-1. Because negative values count backward they will usually be aligned differently within the month than positive values. For example, if a month has 31 days, DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH -1 will overlap DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH 5 and the end of 4.
        Returns:
        day of week in month.

      • getDayOfWeek

        public final int getDayOfWeek()
        Get the day of week from the date. The days of the week begin with 1 which represents Sunday. Monday is represented by 2, Tuesday is represented by 3 and so on.
        Returns:
        The day of week for the input date.

      • getDayOfYear

        public final int getDayOfYear()
        Returns the day of year from the date. The days of the week begin with 1 which represents Sunday. Monday is represented by 2, Tuesday is represented by 3 and so on.
        Returns:
        The day of week for the input date.

      • isLeapYear

        public final boolean isLeapYear()
        Check if the year from this object is a leap year or not.
        Returns:
        true if is year is a leap year, otherwise returns false.

      • getTimeDifference

        public final long getTimeDifference(SDatetime x)
        Get the number of milliseconds the date differs from this object. The number returned is based on the number of milliseconds the date is from the January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
        Parameters:
        x - time to be subtracted.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds the date from the argument differs the date from this object. If the date from the argument is before the date from this object the returned value is negative.

      • timeDifference

        public final long timeDifference(java.util.Calendar x)
        Get the number of milliseconds the date differs from this object. The number returned is based on the number of milliseconds the date is from the January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
        Parameters:
        x - time to be subtracted.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds the date from the argument differs the date from this object. If the date from the argument is before the date from this object the returned value is negative.

      • formatDate

        public final void formatDate(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                             java.lang.String format)
        Append string with date according to given format to StringBuffer. String with format mask contains characters interpreted as follows:
        • a AM/PM marker
        • D day in year
        • d day of month (1 through 31)
        • E day of week (text)

          E, EE, EEE - abbreviated day name (Mon, Tue, .. Sun

          EEEE (and more)- full month name (Monday, Tuesday, .. Sunday

        • e day of week (number 1=Monday, 7=Sunday)
        • F day of week in month
        • G era (0=BC, 1=AD)
        • H hour (0 through 23)
        • h hour (1..12 with am/pm)
        • K hour 0..11 with am/pm)
        • k hour 1..23
        • M month in year (1=January .. 12=December).

          M - number without leading zero

          MM - number with leading zero

          MMM - abbreviated month name (Jan, Feb, .. Dec

          MMMM (and more)- full month name (January, February, .. December

        • m minute (0 through 59)
        • s second (0 through 59)
        • S digits representing a decimal fraction of a second
        • y year
        • W week in month
        • w week in year
        • Z time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm)

          ZZ time zone designator (Z or +h:m or -h:m)

          ZZZZZ time zone designator (Z or +hhmm or -hhmm)

          ZZZZZZ time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm)

        • z zone name

          z, zz, zzz abbreviated zone name (CET)

          zzzz and more full zone name (Central European Time)

        Parameters:
        sb - The StringBuffer where to append a string with date.
        format - The format of created date.
        Throws:
        SRuntimeException -
        • SYS049 Unclosed string quotation.
        • SYS050 Incorrect zone specification in declaration of date and/or time format.

      • getEasterMonday

        public static final SDatetime getEasterMonday(java.util.Calendar date)
        Get Easter Monday. The algorithm used here was published in the Explanatory Supplement to the Astronomical Almanac, Oudin J.M. (1940), ed. Seidelmann P. K. (1992).
        Parameters:
        date - the date containing year where we compute Easter Monday.
        Returns:
        SDatetime object with Easter Monday.
        Throws:
        SRuntimeException - if Easter Monday can't be computed.

      • getEasterMonday

        public static final SDatetime getEasterMonday(int year)
        Get Easter Monday. The algorithm used here was published in the Explanatory Supplement to the Astronomical Almanac, Oudin J.M. (1940), ed. Seidelmann P. K. (1992).
        Parameters:
        year - the year where we compute Easter Monday
        Returns:
        SDatetime object with Easter Monday. If Easter Monday can't be computed then returns null.

      • getCalendarYearsDifference

        public static final int getCalendarYearsDifference(SDatetime date1,
                                                   SDatetime date2)
        Get the number of calendar years date2 after date1. If date2 is before date1 a negative number is returned. This method does not take into account time, days or months. Therefore, the difference between 2000-12-31 11:23:54 PM and 2001-01-01 00:01:12 AM is one year.
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date in the range.
        date2 - The second date in the range.
        Returns:
        The number of years date2 is isAfter date1. If date2 is before date1 returns negative integer.

      • getCalendarMonthsDifference

        public static final int getCalendarMonthsDifference(SDatetime date1,
                                                    SDatetime date2)
        Get the number of calendar months date2 is isAfter date1. If date2 is before date1, then a negative number is returned. This method does not take into account time or days. Therefore, the difference between 2001-04-31 11:23:54 PM and 2001-05-01 00:01:12 AM is one month.
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date in the range.
        date2 - The second date in the range.
        Returns:
        The number of months date2 is isAfter date1. If date2 is before date1 returns negative integer.

      • getCalendarDaysDifference

        public static final int getCalendarDaysDifference(SDatetime date1,
                                                  SDatetime date2)
        Get the number of calendar days date2 is isAfter date1. If date2 is before date1, then a negative number is returned. This method does not take into account time or days. Therefore, the difference between 2001-04-31 11:23:54Z PM and 2001-04-02 00:01:12Z AM is one day.
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date in the range.
        date2 - The second date in the range.
        Returns:
        The number of months date2 is isAfter date1. If date2 is before date1 returns negative integer.

      • add

        public final SDatetime add(int years,
                           int months,
                           int days,
                           int hours,
                           int minutes,
                           int seconds,
                           double fraction)
        Create new date with added values from parameters (each parameter may be negative).
        Parameters:
        years - number of years
        months - number of months
        days - number of days
        hours - number of hours
        minutes - number of minutes
        seconds - number of seconds
        fraction - fraction of second (must be in opened interval -1.0 .. +1.0)
        Returns:
        new date created from the actual and parameters.
